technical.focal_length: Variable - 35mm-85mm for street/documentary, 50mm classic standard, 85mm-135mm for portraits, wide angle 24-35mm for landscapes
technical.depth_of_field: Variable - shallow f/1.4-f/2.8 for portraits/isolation, deep f/8-f/16 for landscapes/street scenes, driven by creative intent
technical.shutter_speed: 1/60s-1/250s for handheld work, 1/500s+ for action, long exposures 1s+ for creative effects, varies by subject
technical.lighting: Emphasis on contrast and form - dramatic side lighting, Rembrandt lighting for portraits, golden hour, harsh shadows acceptable, window light preferred
technical.camera_format: 35mm film historically dominant, medium format 6x6/6x7 for studio work, modern digital full-frame sensors

aesthetic.composition: Strong geometric elements, rule of thirds, leading lines emphasized, negative space crucial, symmetry and patterns highlighted
aesthetic.subject_background: High contrast separation, background often simplified or darkened, subject isolation through tonal contrast rather than color
aesthetic.tonal_range: Full range from pure black to pure white preferred, rich midtones, dramatic contrast often favored over flat lighting
aesthetic.color_approach: Monochromatic grayscale only - red filter effects for dramatic skies, yellow for natural tones, blue for increased contrast
aesthetic.texture_detail: Texture heavily emphasized - skin detail, fabric weave, architectural surfaces, grain structure often celebrated rather than minimized

shooting_approach.subject_distance: Variable by genre - intimate close-ups for portraits, medium distance for environmental context, wide establishing shots for landscapes
shooting_approach.angle_perspective: Eye-level classic, low angles for drama/power, high angles for context, Dutch angles rarely used except for creative effect
shooting_approach.subject_relationship: Both posed and candid traditions strong - formal studio portraits, street photography candids, documentary approach
shooting_approach.environment: All environments - controlled studio lighting, natural outdoor light, urban street contexts, available light interiors

context.historical_context: Originated with photography's invention 1820s-1840s, dominated until 1960s color revolution, experienced revival in 1970s-80s fine art movement
context.key_characteristics: Focus on form, texture, contrast, and composition without color distraction; emphasis on tonal relationships and light quality
context.related_styles: Film noir cinematography, pictorialism, straight photography, documentary photography, street photography

era_variants.notes: 1920s-40s pictorialism soft focus, 1950s-60s high contrast modernism, 1970s+ fine art revival with varied approaches, digital era grain simulation
